verses.text_plain: Then answered Eliphaz the Temanite, and said,
verses.verse_html: 1Then answered Eliphaz the Temanite, and said,

verses.text_plain: Should a wise man utter vain knowledge, and fill his belly with the east wind?
verses.verse_html:
2Should a wise man utter vain knowledge, and fill his belly with the east wind? ▼
▼ vain…: Heb. knowledge of wind

footnotes.body_html: ▼ vain…: Heb. knowledge of wind

verses.text_plain: Should he reason with unprofitable talk? or with speeches wherewith he can do no good?
verses.verse_html: 3Should he reason with unprofitable talk? or with speeches wherewith he can do no good?

tokens.text: wherewith he can do no good

verses.text_plain: Yea, thou castest off fear, and restrainest prayer before God.
verses.verse_html:
4Yea, thou castest off fear, and restrainest prayer before God. ▼
▼ castest…: Heb. makest void
 , ▼
▼ prayer: or, speech

footnotes.body_html: ▼ castest…: Heb. makest void

verses.text_plain: For thy mouth uttereth thine iniquity, and thou choosest the tongue of the crafty.
verses.verse_html:
5For thy mouth uttereth thine iniquity, and thou choosest the tongue of the crafty. ▼
▼ uttereth: Heb. teacheth

verses.text_plain: Thine own mouth condemneth thee, and not I: yea, thine own lips testify against thee.
verses.verse_html: 6Thine own mouth condemneth thee, and not I: yea, thine own lips testify against thee.

tokens.text: thee, and not I: yea, thine own lips

verses.text_plain: Art thou the first man that was born? or wast thou made before the hills?
verses.verse_html: 7Art thou the first man that was born? or wast thou made before the hills?

verses.text_plain: Hast thou heard the secret of God? and dost thou restrain wisdom to thyself?
verses.verse_html: 8Hast thou heard the secret of God? and dost thou restrain wisdom to thyself?

verses.text_plain: What knowest thou, that we know not? what understandest thou, which is not in us?
verses.verse_html: 9What knowest thou, that we know not? what understandest thou, which is not in us?

verses.text_plain: With us are both the grayheaded and very aged men, much elder than thy father.
verses.verse_html: 10With us are both the grayheaded and very aged men, much elder than thy father.

verses.text_plain: Are the consolations of God small with thee? is there any secret thing with thee?
verses.verse_html: 11Are the consolations of God small with thee? is there any secret thing with thee?

tokens.text: with thee? is there any secret

verses.text_plain: Why doth thine heart carry thee away? and what do thy eyes wink at,
verses.verse_html: 12Why doth thine heart carry thee away? and what do thy eyes wink at,

verses.text_plain: That thou turnest thy spirit against God, and lettest such words go out of thy mouth?
verses.verse_html: 13That thou turnest thy spirit against God, and lettest such words go out of thy mouth?

verses.text_plain: What is man, that he should be clean? and he which is born of a woman, that he should be righteous?
verses.verse_html: 14What is man, that he should be clean? and he which is born of a woman, that he should be righteous?

verses.text_plain: Behold, he putteth no trust in his saints; yea, the heavens are not clean in his sight.
verses.verse_html: 15Behold, he putteth no trust in his saints; yea, the heavens are not clean in his sight.

verses.text_plain: How much more abominable and filthy is man, which drinketh iniquity like water?
verses.verse_html: 16How much more abominable and filthy is man, which drinketh iniquity like water?

verses.text_plain: I will shew thee, hear me; and that which I have seen I will declare;
verses.verse_html: 17I will shew thee, hear me; and that which I have seen I will declare;

verses.text_plain: Which wise men have told from their fathers, and have not hid it:
verses.verse_html: 18Which wise men have told from their fathers, and have not hid it:

verses.text_plain: Unto whom alone the earth was given, and no stranger passed among them.
verses.verse_html: 19Unto whom alone the earth was given, and no stranger passed among them.

verses.text_plain: The wicked man travaileth with pain all his days, and the number of years is hidden to the oppressor.
verses.verse_html: 20The wicked man travaileth with pain all his days, and the number of years is hidden to the oppressor.

verses.text_plain: A dreadful sound is in his ears: in prosperity the destroyer shall come upon him.
verses.verse_html:
21A dreadful sound is in his ears: in prosperity the destroyer shall come upon him. ▼
▼ A dreadful…: Heb. A sound of fears

footnotes.body_text: ▼ A dreadful…: Heb. A sound of fears
footnotes.body_html: ▼ A dreadful…: Heb. A sound of fears

verses.text_plain: He believeth not that he shall return out of darkness, and he is waited for of the sword.
verses.verse_html: 22He believeth not that he shall return out of darkness, and he is waited for of the sword.

verses.text_plain: He wandereth abroad for bread, saying, Where is it? he knoweth that the day of darkness is ready at his hand.
verses.verse_html: 23He wandereth abroad for bread, saying, Where is it? he knoweth that the day of darkness is ready at his hand.

verses.text_plain: Trouble and anguish shall make him afraid; they shall prevail against him, as a king ready to the battle.
verses.verse_html: 24Trouble and anguish shall make him afraid; they shall prevail against him, as a king ready to the battle.

verses.text_plain: For he stretcheth out his hand against God, and strengtheneth himself against the Almighty.
verses.verse_html: 25For he stretcheth out his hand against God, and strengtheneth himself against the Almighty.

verses.text_plain: He runneth upon him, even on his neck, upon the thick bosses of his bucklers:
verses.verse_html: 26He runneth upon him, even on his neck, upon the thick bosses of his bucklers:

verses.text_plain: Because he covereth his face with his fatness, and maketh collops of fat on his flanks.
verses.verse_html: 27Because he covereth his face with his fatness, and maketh collops of fat on his flanks.

verses.text_plain: And he dwelleth in desolate cities, and in houses which no man inhabiteth, which are ready to become heaps.
verses.verse_html: 28And he dwelleth in desolate cities, and in houses which no man inhabiteth, which are ready to become heaps.

verses.text_plain: He shall not be rich, neither shall his substance continue, neither shall he prolong the perfection thereof upon the earth.
verses.verse_html: 29He shall not be rich, neither shall his substance continue, neither shall he prolong the perfection thereof upon the earth.

verses.text_plain: He shall not depart out of darkness; the flame shall dry up his branches, and by the breath of his mouth shall he go away.
verses.verse_html: 30He shall not depart out of darkness; the flame shall dry up his branches, and by the breath of his mouth shall he go away.

verses.text_plain: Let not him that is deceived trust in vanity: for vanity shall be his recompence.
verses.verse_html: 31Let not him that is deceived trust in vanity: for vanity shall be his recompence.

tokens.text: Let not him that is deceived

verses.text_plain: It shall be accomplished before his time, and his branch shall not be green.
verses.verse_html:
32It shall be accomplished before his time, and his branch shall not be green. ▼
▼ accomplished: or, cut off

footnotes.body_html: ▼ accomplished: or, cut off

verses.text_plain: He shall shake off his unripe grape as the vine, and shall cast off his flower as the olive.
verses.verse_html: 33He shall shake off his unripe grape as the vine, and shall cast off his flower as the olive.

verses.text_plain: For the congregation of hypocrites shall be desolate, and fire shall consume the tabernacles of bribery.
verses.verse_html: 34For the congregation of hypocrites shall be desolate, and fire shall consume the tabernacles of bribery.

verses.text_plain: They conceive mischief, and bring forth vanity, and their belly prepareth deceit.
verses.verse_html:
35They conceive mischief, and bring forth vanity, and their belly prepareth deceit. ▼
▼ vanity: or, iniquity
